title: Lviv pogroms (1941)
summary: The Lviv pogroms were the consecutive pogroms and massacres of Jews in June and July 1941 in the city of Lw√≥w in Eastern Poland/Western Ukraine (now Lviv, Ukraine). The massacres were perpetrated by Ukrainian nationalists (specifically, the OUN), German death squads, and urban population[1] from 30 June to 2 July, and from 25 to 29 July, during the German invasion of the Soviet Union. Thousands of Jews were killed both in the pogroms and in the Einsatzgruppen killings.
